Talon

talon looked with anguish, she was weak and  unable to help to prote=
ct her babies. She hugged them thightly, The silver baby dragon poped  the =
head and bite the air in a way that could be considered channelling while t=
he black one lowed its head.



--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Sandra Panic=
o <magicquartz@...> wrote:
>
> Was it wise to allow this stranger inside?  =
Was the thought that now races through Tucson's mind.   He gives his newbor=
n back to Talon for safe keeping and then stands up to face the Deciple.  H=
e growls, just as the old dragon would do when he wanted strangers out of h=
is cave.  Two smacks of his tail on the ground tells all.  He was not fooli=
ng around, and now with offspring, he knew he had to keep an even stronger =
vigil.
> 
> " On second thought, I don't think I like your demeanor!  This =
is MY domain and MY family!  And if you are wise you will not approach me a=
ny further!    Do so and I will not hesitate to do whatever it takes to cas=
t you out of the rookery!"
> 
> His eyes narrow as he gives a battle ready =
snarl.  The females who had helped Talon also take his side as they too tak=
e a stand for the sake of Talon and the babies.  The elder female also join=
s this fight as she nods to Tucson.  It's at this time when Tucson lets out=
 a booming roar to assert his place as the Sire of the rookery.  
> 
> Bolt=
s of lightning like energy leaves his mouth as he gives his warning roar .

e, seeing that the old dragon had no mention of another, yet

other who can converse in my language."

rather stiffly. He's swift to shift his weight

f in front of the mouth of the cave.

is about to be born and I wish no harm to come to

> > tilted his head quizzically as he looked at TUCSON and then nodded,

> humor glinting in his eye. "I do not come for your progeny." he said

as he straightened. "There is one who would speak with you."

wn deferentially. A few whispered the name ARCANE in hushed
